Edited March 23, 2014 by AntiMatter001

hex-structural-panels! Cool!

Just a lil' tip, you should do a 10 minute work on the panel's texture (both solar and structural), it doesn't look very good... (good job nonetheless )

I assume those are magnetometers?

They're the stock textures, making new ones would defeat the entire point of SXT. I'm just on low-res, this machine is 6 years old now, so isn't great on the RAM front even with ATM.

It's an extendable RTG, see Voyager I.

Edit: Realised it's 2014 now, it'll be about 7 yo^-1 then. Getting on a bit really.

I can do landing legs without suspension, but the squad's new suspension landing leg module remain a steaming pile of you know what and can die in a fire as far as I'm concerned.

i.e. I can't get the blasted things to work, this has pretty much been my exact reaction every time I've tried to get them to work:

http://i.imgur.com/4ao73O6.gif

As far as I'm concerned, suspension is optional, especially for larger legs. Couldn't speak for anyone else who might want something similar, obviously.

Oh I shouldn't worry about that just yet.

I dub thee: rtg-on-a-stick
Hey Lack, just a suggestion on the hex solar panels- why not make a 7-piece folding version?

Oh I shouldn't worry about that just yet.

O.O wow my computer was 4 years old (the one i had before i got a new one) and it couldn't run ksp... i had 1 GB of ram XD

I realize its stock textures, but you can see where the texture overlaps, creating a line that doesn't look very good. It should be easy to fix, instead of copying the whole thing, try to make a pattern. I hope you understand what i'm saying

I realize its stock textures, but you can see where the texture overlaps, creating a line that doesn't look very good. It should be easy to fix, instead of copying the whole thing, try to make a pattern. I hope you understand what i'm saying

I've done some playing around and it looks a bit better now. Also made a copy without other mods, so I can actually use hi-res.

@Mekan1k,

There you go: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/70881-0-23-Orbit-Manipulator-Series-%28WIP%29-%28Updated-March-12-2014%29

The n-body drifts quite a lot, probably due to problems with barycentres, or lack of thereof, etc.

@Damaske,

Heh, I hadn't thought of that.

@ landeTLS,

Might stick that in the part description.

@AntiMatter,

Heh, I splashed out. 3 whole GB of ram, I mean who would ever want more than that. Although KSP crashes if I go above 1.8GB usage though. Many years of clutter I suspect.

Edit:

Probably not the correct use for the RTG kebab,

there was a qoute from a guy who made the first mobile phone (or smartphone not too sure) "this thing has 100MB of space....why would you need anything more?" (or swomething along those lines)

there was a qoute from a guy who made the first mobile phone (or smartphone not too sure) "this thing has 100MB of space....why would you need anything more?" (or swomething along those lines)

Could be the old '640KB is more memory than anyone will ever need'. Commonly (and falsely) attributed to Bill Gates.

Edited March 24, 2014 by Lack

there was a qoute from a guy who made the first mobile phone (or smartphone not too sure) "this thing has 100MB of space....why would you need anything more?" (or swomething along those lines)

It's 640KB and it's about RAM on the early PCs, and yes it's accredited to Bill Gates...

SXT-alpha-10.zip

Change log:

Added Hexagonal Solar Panel

Added Hexagonal Structural Panel

Added 0.625m Pipes

Added 2 Extendable RTGs

Fixed textures on 0.625m 'Barrel'

Think that's the bulk of it.
do you plan on expanding upon the 3.75m series?

Oh sweet!

(filler)

These Heat Shields should "work" with deadly re-entry correct?

I figured i could attach them to some servos and unfold them on re-ntry for larger crafts.

do you plan on expanding upon the 3.75m series?

I want to get a feel for ARM's 3.75m parts first. I'm not entirely sold on the idea of making the 3.75m parts a 'full set', over primarily being used for lifter and engine stages, either (command pods, etc.)

@TheFunnyOne,

They have a very high heat-tolerance (roughly 10k) so that should be alright, although I believe DRE does things slightly differently now-a-days so I'm not 100% on that.

Could be the old '640KB is more memory than anyone will ever need'. Commonly (and falsely) attributed to Bill Gates.
